alert.note: Alert for Greene; Lenoir; Pitt (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 14 at 8:48PM EST until January 18 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Newport/Morehead City
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in North Carolina... Contentnea Creek Near Hookerton affecting Lenoir, Pitt and Greene Counties. For the Contentnea Creek...including Hookerton...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Contentnea Creek near Hookerton. * WHEN...Until early Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Minor flooding of low lying areas adjacent to creek can be expected. Several homes threatened by water in northwest Greene County near HWY 58. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 PM EST Sunday the stage was 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 13.1 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at water.weather.gov/ahps. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 1100 AM EST.
